intro: Smallanthus macvaughii, commonly known as the MacVaugh's smallanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cool, temperate climate of its native habitat. Smallanthus macvaughii has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
